lines.text: See you later, my little artichoke.
All right, my Spanish onion.
What you haven't got is glamour.
No, and I don't wear a beret either.

[aggressively]
My name's Aloysius K. Reilly!
Well, don't get sore at me. I wasn't at the Christening.
Something's rotten in Denmark.
Well, don't look at me. I never been there.
I'm gonna give hat girl a crack at Toddy Williams part.
You're not on the level, are you?
I certainly am.
But there's a hundred girls can dance better than that.
Well, what of it? She's got pep, she's refreshing, and she crtainly is a new face.
A new face - yeah - but she's gotta dance with her feet.
Cut it out, Larry. Hitting a lady ain't cricket. It ain't even pinochle.
How do they look?
[Serves two eggs, sunnyside up]
I've seen Greta Garbo and the Mona Lisa; but, those are the most beautiful eyes I've ever looked into.
Put down the skull, Hamlet. Everything's gonna be all right.
Now, if you could only sing or dance or juggle or something, I could fix it up like that. Jake Sherman's putting on a show.
You know Jake Sherman?
Couldn't be closer to him if I was his Siamese brother.
Then she works. Mabel can dance. I've been teachin' her steps ever since she was a little nipper.
Aunt Mimi was right when she said that she taught me all she knew about dancing. But, Aunti's got flat feet and I think it might show up in my work.
You ever see anybody watch a chorus girl's feet? Come on.
Boy, you could sell ice blocks in Siberia.
You telling me? That's how I earn my passage money to this country.
No foolin'?
Sure. You know when corsets went out of style, I sent two boatloads to China and I sold them to bandits for bullet-proof vests.
I can remember when I was a show girl.
So can half the male population of New York.
Listen, if you ever lose that voice, you'll end up as a ventriloquist dummy.
I grew up with Jake and you ain't him.
What? You grew up with me?
Don't give me that. You ain't you. You're somebody else pretending to be him.
Oh, well, maybe I'm wrong.
I think you're both just a couple of cheap chiselers.
Just a minute! I don't care whether you're Jake Sherman or the four Marx Brothers. But, you can't get away with calling me a chiseler.
Listen, the safest thing that can happen to you right now is a case of lock jaw.
Now, look young lady, do I look like the type of man who goes around impersonating himself? Well, I'm not. I would like very much to convince you that I'm me.
What am I supposed to do? Stand around while you chat with every little dame that wanders in off the street?
Oh, but, Toddy!
Hot Toddy, to you; Pelican Pan!
Beware of good looking prize fighters. I knew one once. He spent so much time on the canvas, I started thinking of him as a portrait.
Some day I'll meet that dame. When I do, I'll spank her so tender she can sit on a newspaper and read the headlines.
I should know about figures, I've handled enough models.
He's probably some old coot with removable hair and an apartment full of etchings.
He got more space this morning than he did when he won the title. I've given him color.
black and blue. He thinks she put that stuff in the paper.
Well, so what. He can't deny it without making a sap out of himself.
I'm supposed to be a fighter and what am I doing? Playing Post Office all over the front page with a dame!
You've got to remember, champ, all the world loves a lover.
Who was that?
Foxy Woxy Corporation. They make Lovies.
Say I Love You with a Breathe of Spring.
What?
Lovies. You know, them breathe killers.
If you been eatin' onions, all you have to do is pop one in your clapper and you blow out like a violet.
You're gettin' paid for being in the show, aren't ya?
Yes, as a dancer - not a sparing partner for an egotistical pug-ugly!
Just think, Mabel, you'll be on the front page right along with Mussolini and...
I don't want to be on the front page with anybody.
Well, of course, if you wanna be a snob.
Larry Cain the Battling Adonis of the Squared Circle.
Don't say things like that.
Just when I'm gonna cash in on the boy, this beautiful thing comes into his life an kicks me right in the puss!
The girl had a future until you came along. What she got with a prize-fighter?
Garage mechanic.
With a garage mechanic? Thank you. Nothing but a free valve grind.
Well, I may be crazy; but, I'm going to Philadelphia, just the same.
The Show Must Go On!
Why?
